overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students explore dilations on the plane using the terms dilation, center of dilation, scale factor, dilation factor, enlargement, and reduction. They dilate various objects using scale factors greater than and less than 1. Students then determine side lengths and angle measures after enlargements and reductions to verify similarity. They connect dilations to changing image sizes in software programs.

overview_item_data_items: I can dilate figures given a center of dilation and scale factor to create an enlargement or a reduction of the original figure.
I can identify corresponding sides and corresponding angles of similar figures.
I can identify the scale factor of a dilation.
I can describe a sequence of transformations that shows two figures are similar.
Dilation is a transformation that produces images that are the same shape as the pre-image but not the same size.
When you dilate a figure with a scale factor greater than 1, the resulting similar figure is an enlargement.
In an enlargement, each side length is multiplied by a scale factor greater than 1.
When you dilate a figure with a scale factor less than 1, the resulting similar figure is a reduction.
In a reduction, each side length is multiplied by a scale factor less than 1.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: To Scale or Not to Scale
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students consider images of a logo to determine which adjusted logos are to scale.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Dilating Figures with a Scale Factor Greater Than 1
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students determine equivalent ratios for, compare the angles of, and make conclusions about the enlargement of a logo.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Dilating Figures with a Scale Factor Less Than 1
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students determine equivalent ratios for, compare the angles of, and make conclusions about the reduction of a logo.
Students analyze dilated images by looking at dimensions and percent enlargement or reduction.
Students draw images of a curved figure and then generalize about similar figures and congruent figures.
